title: Team up for Party Rewards before they’re gone!

replies.body: I've played like 25 games with friends and I haven't gotten a single thing.

I like the concept for party rewards, but the problem is, there is like .1% chance of getting a significant reward. A 6 ip bonus to a 70 ip game is almost nothing. After playing lots of games it has stacked up to about 200 ip but still, I've played a lot of games. And, i've never gotten the quote "2x ip with a friend" or "4x ip with 2 friends". NEVER, even after like 50 games. Plz improve the odds of these things, RITO PLZ.

I'm with you here. I feel like it was hyped as this awesome incentive to group up. I understand that the 16x for playing with a group of 5 is rare, but I have yet to even get a 2x multiplier. The biggest bonus was around 40 IP, and that was one game.

Not that I'm complaining about extra IP. I appreciate all of it, even if it's just a little. I do think the expectation was set, though, that it would be at least a little higher than a piddling 0-5 IP per game.

I stopped after about 10 games where the highest bonus in a full 5 mn premade was like 40. Each time it was a huge dissapointment, so it made even victories kinda crappy. If they increased the chance of getting a decent gain, or put a higher gain floor it would be cool and actually promote teaming up...

Riot, I really feel like you guys should have clarified what these "Party Rewards" were and how they worked. Me and my group of 6 friends were under the assumption that if we played in a group of 5, that 1/100 or so games all the IP earned that game would be multiplied by x16. Which is a huge bounty, I mean 100 IP multiplied by x16 is enough to grab a new champ or a few runes! Sounds like a **REAL **Jackpot! Even if it was rare! We were freaking out playing at least 10 games a day for the past week or so never seeing this jackpot. That is until I just realized that after each game we would get about 1-4 bonus IP just for playing in a group, then just now my last game, that bonus jumped to 38 IP! and I realized that that "x16 Jackpot" only applied to that miniscule amount of IP you get for playing with friends. Whippdy do! I can possibly maybe get an extra 20-40 IP every 30 games... YAY! =.= we felt **VERY **let down and straight up like we were **lied** to. The system is great I guess, its some extra IP, but don't go flashing around your so called "x6" "x8" and "x16" bonus jackpots like they are some huge , well **JACKPOT** when in all respects they are just a fraction of the amount of IP you actually got FROM the game itself put on top, I got 120 IP last game, that means I got like 30% more IP with a so called "x16 Jackpot" That doesn't make any sense! Just please clarify what these events are and how they work next time? So we don't have as much confusion and anger over events such as these that advertise one thing and give another. Thank you!
IMHO, if Riot does bring it back, they need to make the odds for getting a multiplier higher. When you win 50 IP in the game then get a 7 IP bonus, it isn't very noticeable.
Party rewards? What's that? No seriously, I've teamed up with my friends at least 25 times during this event and haven't gotten a single thing. I love Riot but really, rito pls.

This is really neat. Thanks for trying out cool stuff like this that encourages people to do things that they should all be doing to maximize their enjoyment of this game anyways!

While party rewards are super cool, it feels like the lower end of rewards is a little too consistent (e.g., 0-2 when playing in a 2 person group or 0-5ish when playing in a larger group). I know you have to carefully budget the IP you give out, but maybe the medium rewards could be a little more consistent and have smaller (or less frequent) large jackpots. Sometimes you only have time for one or two games and when they both turn up with 0-2 group bonus IP, it's kind of a let down. Seems like a lot of people here might agree.  Just my initial thoughts!

Thanks again! Great idea!

I got 85 bonus ip off of one game. You get a small bonus just for the fact that you teamed up (which is where all your 8 and 16 ip bonuses every game are most likely coming from), but the big win is a random check. You have the chance to get up to the stated amount, but even then you might only get a small bonus from it. There is no guarantee that you're going to walk away with a giant pile of ip. The bonus for a full party is somewhere around 1600 ip max? Maybe 1200? Somewhere in that vicinity. That's a very excessive amount of ip that would add up entirely too fast.

I got excited when I first saw this but later disappointed when I had my first win of the day with a party of friends but the multiplier gave a minuscule amount of IP. Why Riot must you deceive us all?

One of the biggest issues I've found with this system is that the IP rewarded is intended to be some sort of "bonus". This gives Riot the freedom to say "You got the IP you earned, this is just a little bit extra!" And while there's nothing exactly wrong with that idea, the real issue is that this "bonus" IP has actually been **necessary** for quite some time.

The price of runes and champions has been way too high for as long as I can remember. I think the average IP earned per game should be increased (like with this proposed Party Rewards system), or the prices for runes/champs should be reduced/removed.
